div.div:
SICr
do_create
( ScndIdxWork )
snap := AtomicLinkedListSnapshot{
snap_head_excl
, tail_excl=None };
snap_pi
:=
snap.iter().filter_map( (unit) -> unit.pi ).k_merge().filter( keep non-Tombstone );
For each (PK,PV) in snap_pi :
Write to a Memtable (without log).
Periodically flush to a new SSTable.
If there were no data :
// There should be no file to delete.
return;
K-merge all SSTables.
Remove non-final SSTables.
cu := CommittedUnit w/ ...
commit_ver_lo_incl == commit_ver_hi_incl :=
output_commit_ver
timestamp_num := 0
node := Box( ListNode( ... cu ... ) );
node.next =
snap_head_excl
.next.load();
snap_head_excl
.next.store( node );
With
db_state
.lock_exclusive() :
set_scnd_idx_as_readable
( sv_spec ), which does ...
scnd_idxs
[ sv_spec ].
is_readable
= true ;
Write to disk.

div.div:
FCJob::
flush_and_compact
()
With
lsm_state
.lock_exclusive() :
// Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They're lumped in here for legibility.
snap_head_excl :=
update_or_push
() ...
If the existing head is a dummy : nothing to update.
Else : push new dummy w/ { hold_count=0,
is_fence
=false }
traverse_and_compact( snap_head_excl );

div.div:
DB::
create_scnd_idx
()
Args:
SVSpec
Steps:
With
db_state
.lock_shared() :
If
scnd_idxs
.has_key( sv_spec ) :
Return "Already exists and <is | isn't> being created".
With
db_state
.lock_exclusive() :
// It's preferrable to wait for the exclusive lock outside the job thread.
If
scnd_idxs
.has_key( sv_spec ) :
Return "Already exists and <is | isn't> being created".
define_new_scnd_idx
( sv_spec ), which does ...
si_num :=
next_scnd_idx_num
.get_and_inc();
scnd_idxs
.insert( sv_spec, ( si_num,
is_readable
=false ) );
Write to disk.
(tx, rx) := oneshot::channel();
req := ScndIdxCreationRequest( sv_spec, si_num, tx );
scnd_idx_creation_request
.send( req );
resp := rx.receive();
return resp;

div.div:
FCJob::
do_flush_and_compact
( slice, skip_tombstones, db_state_guard )
-> Option< Box< ListNode< LsmElem > > >
With db_state guard :=
db_state
.lock_shared() :
Create a new empty SSTable-based CompactedUnit.
For each of {PI; and SIs in db_state_guard.
scnd_idxs
.keys() regardless of `
is_readable
`} :
K-merge across the slice --> produce one SSTable.
If skipping tombstones, do so.
If the newly produced SSTable is non-empty :
Assign the new SSTable into the new CommittedUnit.
If the newly produced CommittedUnit is non-empty :
On disk, serialize CommitInfo with ...
commit_ver_hi_incl = max in slice
commit_ver_lo_incl = min in slcie
timestamp_num = (max in slice) + 1
Move the new CommittedUnit into a Box< ListNode< LsmElem > >. Return this.
Else :
committed_unit.remove_dir();
Return None.

div.div:
DB::
delete_scnd_idx
()
Args:
SVSpec
Steps:
With
db_state
.lock_shared() :
If
scnd_idxs
[ sv_spec ].
is_readable
!= true :
Return "<Doesn't exist | It's being built>".
With
db_state
.lock_exclusive() :
If
scnd_idxs
[ sv_spec ].
is_readable
!= true :
Return "<Doesn't exist | It's being built>".
remove_scnd_idx
( sv_spec );
/*
That's it!
Leave all data (in memory and on disk) in place. Let compaction eventually implicitly erase them.
The use of ScndIdxNum ensures that, if a SI is later re-created for the just-deleted SVSpec, any lingering existing data would remain unused.
*/

div.div:
LsmDir::
load_or_new
()
pq := new BinaryHeap< CommitInfo >;
For unit_dir in `ls lsm/` :
If commit_info.txt doesn't exist :
Ignore this unit. Print warning.
Else :
Load CommitInfo.
Push CommitInfo into pq.
nodes: = empty Vec;
// pq prioritizes CommitInfo by { highest commit_ver_hi_incl; tie-breaker by highest timestamp_num }.
next_commit_ver := pq.peek().commit_ver_hi_incl + 1; If empty, zero.
While pq is not empty :
cu_info := pq.pop();
If curr commit_ver range overlaps with previous commit_ver range :
Ignore this unit. Print warning.
Else :
Load CommitInfo into CommittedUnit.
Push CommittedUnit into nodes.
list := AtomicLinkedList::from_elems( nodes );
return (LsmDir, LsmState);

div.div:
Txn::
try_commit
()
With
lsm_state
.lock_exclusive() :
// Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They're lumped in here for legibility.
If
snap_next_commit_ver
!=
next_commit_ver
:
snap
.tail_excl.hold_count -= 1; if
snap
.tail_excl is Some
snap
.tail_excl = Some(
snap
.head_excl );
snap
.head_excl :=
update_or_push
() ...
If the existing head is a dummy : dummy.hold_count += 1;
Else : push new dummy w/ { hold_count=1,
is_fence
=false }
If {prior
snap
.tail_excl became non-held} :
replace_avail
.send( () );
snap_next_commit_ver
=
next_commit_ver
;
snap_list_ver
, min_held_list_ver =
hold_and_unhold_list_ver
(
snap_list_ver
);
If min_held_list_ver changed :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
return "need to check for conflict";
Else :
committed_unit := CommittedUnit::from(
staging
.take(),
next_commit_ver
);
// Serializing is expensive, and we're doing it under mutex guard!
On disk, serialize CommitInfo with ...
commit_ver_lo_incl == commit_ver_hi_incl :=
next_commit_ver
timestamp_num := 0
In memory, move each WritableMemLog into ReadonlyMemLog.
node := Box( ListNode( ... committed_unit ... ) )
list.
push
( node );
snap
.tail_excl
.hold_count -= 1; if
snap
.tail_excl
is Some
snap
.head_excl
.hold_count -= 1;
replace_avail
.send( () );
// The list is definitely replaceable, due to the presence of a new MemLog.
next_commit_ver
+= 1;
min_held_list_ver :=
unhold_list_ver
(
snap_list_ver
);
If min_held_list_ver changed :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
return "just committed";

Txn::
has_conflict()
committed_units :=
snap
.filter( keep CommittedUnit and ignore Dummy );
For each CommittedUnit :
For each of {PI and SIs} that was written-to in
staging
:
If {
dependent_itvs_*
<--> CommittedEntrySet } overlap :
Return "yes conflict".
Return "no conflict".

div.div:
Txn::
reset
()
With
lsm_state
.lock_exclusive() :
// Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They're lumped in here for legibility.
snap
.tail_excl.hold_count -= 1; if
snap
.tail_excl is Some
snap
.head_excl.hold_count -= 1;
snap
.tail_excl = None;
snap
.head_excl :=
update_or_push
() ...
If the existing head is a dummy : dummy.hold_count += 1;
Else : push new dummy w/ {
hold_count=1,
is_fence
=false }
If {prior
snap
.tail_excl and/or
snap
.head_excl became non-held} :
replace_avail
.send( () );
snap_next_commit_ver
=
next_commit_ver
;
snap_list_ver
, min_held_list_ver =
hold_and_unhold_list_ver
(
snap_list_ver
);
If min_held_list_ver changed :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
snap_vec
= None;
dependent_itvs_prim
.clear();
dependent_itvs_scnds
.clear();
if
staging
is Some :
staging
.clear();

div.div:
Txn::
close
()
With
lsm_state
.lock_exclusive() :
// Some lines here should be done outside the mutex guard. They're lumped in here for legibility.
snap
.tail_excl.hold_count -= 1; if
snap
.tail_excl is Some
snap
.head_excl.hold_count -= 1;
If {prior
snap
.tail_excl and/or
snap
.head_excl became non-held} :
replace_avail
.send( () );
min_held_list_ver :=
unhold_list_ver
(
snap_list_ver
);
If min_held_list_ver changed :
min_held_list_ver
.send_if_modified( if last-sent mhlv < known mhlv );
if
staging
is Some :
staging
.remove_dir();

div.div:
/* All these methdos are public to the client callback. */
Txn::
get_pk_one
( pk )
dependent_itvs_prim
.add( (pk,pk) );
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.prim );
snap :=
snap
.map( (unit) -> unit.pi );
Get one from [stg, snap]. Return result.
Txn::
get_pk_range
( pk_lo, pk_hi )
dependent_itvs_prim
.add( (pk_lo,pk_hi) );
if
snap_vec
is None: collect it from
snap
.
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.prim );
snap :=
snap_vec
.map( (unit) -> unit.pi );
K-merge {stg + snap}. Return result.
Txn::
get_sv_range
( sv_spec, sv_lo, sv_hi )
// This is a simplistic query engine, which depends on exactly one index.
If
scnd_idxs
[sv_spec] doesn't exist or
is_readable
==false: return failure.
si_num :=
scnd_idxs
[sv_spec].si_num;
If
dependent_itvs_scnds
[si_num] doesn't exist: create new empty.
dependent_itvs_scnds
[si_num].add( (sv_lo,sv_hi) );
if
snap_vec
is None: collect it from
snap
.
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.scnds.get(si_num) );
snap :=
snap_vec
.map( (unit) -> unit.scnds.get(si_num) );
K-merge {stg + snap}. Return result.
Txn::
put
( pk, new_pv )
dependent_itvs_prim
.add( (pk,pk) );
// We must treat concurrent writes on the same PK as a conflict, because they generally invalidate deltas on SIs in staging.
stg :=
staging
.map( (stg) -> stg.prim );
snap :=
snap
.map( (unit) -> unit.pi );
old_pv := Get one from [stg, snap];
If
staging
is None: create new empty.
For each si_num in
db_state_guard
.scnd_idxs :
// Assess all SIs, regardless of `
is_readable
`.
If there is a delta for this SI:
If
staging
.scnds[si_num] doesn't exist: create new empty.
staging
.scnds[si_num].put( the_delta );
staging
.prim
.put( (PK,PV) );

div.div:
Termination sequence
This sequence works in cooperation with
DB::terminate()
Txn::run()
Steps:
is_terminating
bool is set to true.
From now on, no new txn can start.
Note, already-running txns can still additionally hold
curr_list_ver
.
is_terminating
Conditional Variable is set.
F+C is notified.
While F+C's local
dangling_nodes
is not empty :
F+C waits on
min_held_list_ver
.
F+C removes from
dangling_nodes
.
/*
min_held_list_ver
does not inform whether
curr_list_ver
is held or not. But this is irrelevant for the purpose of GC.
min_held_list_ver
does not inform whether all list_vers <
curr_list_ver
are non-held. Reason: F+C may bump
curr_list_ver
.
Therefore, we omit the above while-loop.
*/
While
held_list_vers
is not empty :
// It would suffice to check whether
held_list_vers
is empty except for potentially
curr_list_ver
.
Sleep a bit.
GC all nodes in
dangling_nodes
.

div.div:
FCJob::
poll_held_list_vers_then_gc
()
While true :
With
lsm_state
.lock_exclusive() :
If
held_list_vers
is empty :
break;
Sleep a bit;
For each (_, nodes) in
dangling_nodes
:
For each node :
Remove files. Drop memory.

Txn::
run
( db, client_cb )
With db_state_guard =
db_state
.lock_shared() :
// This guard is held for the duration of the txn.
txn := Txn::new( ... );
Make the txn go through state transitions.
Return what client_cb returns.
